importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the Hamas-led attack on Israel that triggered the current conflict and led to the Israeli military campaign in Gaza.
The start date of the US-brokered ceasefire deal that initiated the first phase of hostage exchange and humanitarian relief in Gaza.
The date of the latest news report, indicating ongoing developments in the ceasefire and hostage situation following the initial agreement.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which the US-brokered ceasefire agreement is in effect, including the exchange of hostages, prisoner releases, and aid deliveries.

keyTakeAways: Hamas has handed over a body it claims is a Gaza hostage, which Israel is now formally identifying.
Under the first phase of the US-brokered ceasefire, Hamas has returned 20 living hostages and 12 of 28 deceased hostages, but not all deceased bodies.
Israel has expressed anger over the incomplete return of deceased hostages, insisting Hamas must fulfill its obligations under the agreement.
Hamas cites difficulty locating bodies amid rubble in Gaza as a reason for delays.
In return for the return of Israeli hostage remains, Israel has released 250 Palestinian prisoners and 1,718 detainees from Gaza, and returned 15 Palestinian bodies.
The ceasefire has seen an influx of humanitarian aid, a partial Israeli withdrawal, and a halt in fighting, though deadly violence flared on Sunday.
Israel accused Hamas of launching an attack in Rafah that killed two soldiers, leading to strikes killing at least 45 Palestinians.
Hamas claims it was unaware of the clashes, and both sides accuse each other of breaching the ceasefire.
Israel has resumed enforcement of the ceasefire, stating it will respond firmly to any violations.
US President Donald Trump and his envoys Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner traveled to Israel to support the truce.
The Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) control about half of Gaza, demarcated by the Yellow Line, which has been visually marked by bulldozers.
Palestinian health officials reported Israeli fire killed three people east of Gaza City, with the IDF claiming they targeted terrorists who crossed the Yellow Line.
The Israeli military campaign began in response to the 7 October 2023 attack that killed about 1,200 Israelis and took 251 hostage.
According to the Hamas-run health ministry, at least 68,216 people have been killed in Gaza since the start of the Israeli military campaign.

namedEntities.name: Hamas
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The article identifies Hamas as the entity holding and releasing hostages, accused of violating the ceasefire, and cited as facing challenges in recovering bodies under rubble.

namedEntities.name: Israel Defense Forces (IDF)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The IDF is central to the article, as it is responsible for receiving the body, conducting military operations, and enforcing the ceasefire.

namedEntities.name: United States
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The US brokered the ceasefire deal and its envoys are present in the region to monitor and support the agreement.

namedEntities.name: Donald Trump
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Trump is highlighted as a key figure who affirmed the ceasefire's continuation and sent envoys to reinforce the truce.

namedEntities.name: Steve Witkoff
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is a US diplomatic representative involved in the ceasefire negotiations and presence in Israel.

namedEntities.name: Jared Kushner
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is present in Israel as part of the US delegation supporting the ceasefire and monitoring compliance.

namedEntities.name: Red Cross
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Red Cross transported the body from Gaza to Israeli forces for identification, playing a logistical and humanitarian role.

namedEntities.name: Gaza Strip
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Geopolitical region in the Middle East
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The main location of the conflict, hostage exchange, military actions, and humanitarian aid delivery.

namedEntities.name: Yellow Line
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The boundary dividing Israeli-controlled and Palestinian areas in Gaza, subject to confusion and military incidents.

namedEntities.name: Rafah
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Area in Gaza under Israeli control
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Site of a recent Israeli strike, where Hamas claimed it was unaware of hostilities and Israeli forces accused Hamas of an attack.

namedEntities.name: Shejaiya
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Location where Israeli forces fired on individuals reportedly crossing the Yellow Line.

namedEntities.name: Hamas-run health ministry
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Provides official figures on casualties, which are considered reliable by the UN, establishing a key data source for the conflict's human cost.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Under a US-brokered ceasefire that began on 10 October 2025, Hamas has returned 20 living hostages and 12 of 28 deceased hostages, but not all bodies, prompting Israeli anger over non-compliance. The body handed over by Hamas is being formally identified by Israeli forces, with Hamas citing rubble-related challenges in recovery. Israel has released 250 Palestinian prisoners and 1,718 detainees and returned 15 Palestinian bodies in return. The ceasefire has seen humanitarian aid increases and a partial Israeli withdrawal, though violence flared when Israel accused Hamas of attacking in Rafah, killing at least 45 Palestinians. Both sides accuse each other of breaching the agreement, and Israel has resumed enforcement. US President Donald Trump and envoys Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner are present to support the truce. The IDF controls half of Gaza, demarcated by the Yellow Line, which has been visibly marked. Palestinian health officials report Israeli fire killed three people near Gaza City, and the conflict remains active despite the ceasefire.
title: Israel receives body Hamas says is Gaza hostage
